sentence: When the map fell through, Cawthorn went back to a newly configured 11th District and moved to muscle out Michele Woodhouse, the Republican he had endorsed to take his place in the state's far-western district and personally encouraged to run (Woodhouse has refused to stand down and is among Cawthorn's primary opponents).
author: David M. Drucker
title: 'His act is wearing thin': North Carolina Republicans gripe about Madison Cawthorn

sentence: Some are nuisance candidates, but others are serious, such as GOP district chair Michele Woodhouse and Chuck Edwards, a state senator who represents a significant chunk of the new seat.
title: Opinion: Madison Cawthorn is in trouble. And it's entirely his own fault.
